page.title: 13BLACKO TOWER
page.content: From{BLACKO TOWER}you can see all our Domesday block. The tower was built by {Johnathan Stansfield}in 1890 and restored in 1950, helped by contributions from the villagers of Blacko. You can see into the Yorkshire Dales, Nelson and Burnley from the top of the tower. All the people in our school went up there in June 1985. Johnathan built the tower to see over into Ribblesdale but he could not because of the bigger hills in front of him. When people asked him why he built the tower he said, "I've never drunk or smoked in my life so I'm making this my hobby". He died in 1894 aged 71 and the tower still stands there on the top of the hill. Each year, on{BLACKO SPORTS DAY,}the children of Blacko race to the Tower and back.
